No, it's not recommended to ignore chronic pain or hope it will go away on its own. Ignoring chronic pain can lead to the development of chronic pain syndrome, a condition in which the ongoing pain becomes more severe and lasts for longer periods. Ignoring pain could also mask an underlying medical condition that requires treatment, which could further complicate your condition. 

Additionally, chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, causing physical, emotional, and social difficulties. It can lead to depression, fatigue, and anxiety, making it hard to enjoy life or perform everyday tasks.

Ignoring the problem may also lead to the use of other unhealthy coping mechanisms such as alcohol or drug abuse. It's important to take chronic pain seriously and seek appropriate medical care and attention to manage it effectively.
